data.title: Gulf Coast Records
data.meta_description:
Gulf Coast Records was founded by Mike Zito and Guy Hale in 2018.
The label is based in Nederland, TX and is focusing on Regional Roots, Blues and Americana genres. The mutual passion of the founders is to lift up artists and help them get their music out to the world.

Las Vegas-based Jimmy Carpenter is on a roll. The saxophonist/ singer/ songwriter is a perennial favorite at the annual Blues Music Awards in Memphis, having been voted in the â€œBest Instrumentalist/Hornâ€ category with seven nominations and two wins. Now, he proves heâ€™s Just Got Started, with the upcoming release of his new album on September 13. Just Got Started was recorded in March at Greaseland Studios in San Jose, California, and was produced, engineered, mixed and mastered by Christoffer "Kid" Andersen.

"Jimmy Carpenter continues to be a stand-out artist in the contemporary Blues genre. His songwriting is on point and his voice is front and center,â€ says Gulf Coast president Mike Zito. â€œArguably one of the best sax players around, his artistry on this new record has come together to make the circle complete."

â€‹

â€œWhen my dear friend Mike Zito asked if I'd be interested in working with producer Kid Andersen at Greaseland Studios for my third Gulf Coast Records release, my answer was an immediate and empathic â€˜YES!,â€ recalls Carpenter. â€œKid has done some very fine work with several friends of mine, and I love those records.

â€‹

â€œI love Soul music, and my idea for this one was to lean in that direction. Still Blues-based, but also song oriented and funky cool with a kind of vintage soul vibe. I told Kid that, and he immediately said â€˜Yes, we can do that!â€™

â€‹

â€œThe week before the session I was a little nervous, and called my friend Albert Castiglia, who had just recorded there. He gave me some very good advice: â€˜Jimmy, just trust Kid, he has a plan;â€™ and he was so right. And the plan was to take my songs and put them in the capable hands of some of the finest musicians on the planet, which worked out very well.â€

â€œThe title track, â€˜(Feels Like) I Just Got Started,â€™ is my attempt to use the last set of a night as a metaphor for my life in music,â€ explains Carpenter.â€ I've been at this a very long time and honestly, my career is at its high point; it's not ebbing, it's flowing! I really do feel in many ways like I'm just getting started. There's a line in the bridge, â€˜Don't blink or you'll miss it!â€™ and that is a fact!

â€‹

â€œLiving in Vegas, people often ask if I'm a gambler. My stock answer is always - I only gamble with my heart. That's been banging around my head for years, and I finally wrote the song. It has the advantage of being true, and that gamble has paid off nicely here in Sin City.

â€‹

â€œThere are nods to some of the Blues icons: a very different version of Little Walter's â€˜My Babe;â€™ a nice cover of Otis Rush's â€˜Working Man;â€™ a nod to Delbert McClinton, one of my favorite people, and his song â€˜Leap of Faithâ€™ (Lisa â€˜Li'l Babyâ€™ Andersen absolutely crushes that one); as well as a super funky version of Allen Toussaint's â€˜Night People.â€™

â€‹

â€œAnd for the first time I was able to record not one, but two tunes from my saxophone hero, King Curtis: â€˜Soul Themeâ€™ and â€˜Midnight Blue.â€™ In kind of a full circle thing, bass player Jerry Jemmott was King Curtis' bassist, so I felt kind of a cosmic connection to him as we recorded those, and of course, Jerry's bass lines were perfect.

â€‹

â€‹

â€œThis album is very different than the previous five; more groovy and soulful, but not overdone. The musicianship really brings it home, and I could feel the love as we recorded it. I'm playing these songs live, and from the reaction we're getting, I think the people dig it! I am so grateful for Kid's steady hand and unparalleled guitar work, Jerry Jemmott, Derrick D'Mar Martin, Jim Pugh, Bobby Vega, and Lisa Andersen for taking really good care of me and my songs... And of course, Mike Zito and everyone at Gulf Coast for this opportunity. I Just Got Started, and I still got a long way to go!â€

NEW SINGLE FROM ALBERT CASTIGLIA

MAMA, I LOVE YOU FEAT. KEVIN BURT

â€œ â€™Mama, I Love Youâ€™ was written a few years back after witnessing a black man getting killed on camera at the hands of a white man for no reason other than fear and hate. It wasnâ€™t the first time I had witnessed such an act but after the last time, I couldnâ€™t hold back the overwhelming feelings of sadness and rage. I pitched the song to my friend Kevin Burt, who is African American, for him to sing on his next album but he felt that the message would be more powerful if I, a white man were to sing it. He telling me that took me a while to process because I just didnâ€™t feel that way at the time. Later on as the song evolved and developed musically and lyrically, I warmed up to the idea of singing it but I suggested that we do it as a duet. I wrote the song, but Kevin and bass legend Jerry Jemmott added so much to the tune in the studio that I gave them songwriting credit as well. It was an honor and a privilege to create this with them.â€

â€‹

Albert adds, â€œWhen I write songs, theyâ€™re usually fueled by intense joy, sadness and anger. Thatâ€™s just how it is with me. The concept of racism is something I will never understand. For someone to hate another based on the color of their skin befuddles me and makes me furious to no end. Thereâ€™s never been a place for it and I feel itâ€™s hindered this countryâ€™s ability to reach its full potential, and I say this as a loyal American. I love this country very much, but there is still much left to be done here in terms of race relations and understanding one another.â€ -- Albert Castiglia

WE'RE STILL FRIENDS ft. MIKE ZITO

from LARA PRICE'S new release HALF & HALF.

â€œIn the spirit of the upcoming Trump/Biden debate, "We're Still Friends" is a fun rockin' sing-along to remind folks that it's ok to agree to disagree." -- Lara Price

Fresh from winning another Blues Music Award at the recent festivities in

Memphis for â€œBest Blues Rock Albumâ€ as a member of the â€œBlood Brothers,â€ along with labelmate MikeZito, Albert Castiglia comes out guitar-slinging on his new solo Gulf Coast Records album, RighteousSouls, set for release on July 19th. Gulf Coast will release the new albumâ€™s first single, â€œCenterline,â€ featuring Popa Chubby (along with single and album digital pre-orders at all digital outlets), on June 14; to be followed by â€œMama I Love You,â€ featuring Kevin Burt, on June 28; and â€œYou Canâ€™t Judge a Book By the Cover,â€ featuring Christone â€Kingfishâ€ Ingram and Rayne Castiglia, on July 12th.

"During last yearâ€™s â€˜Blood Brothersâ€™ tour, Mike Zito informed me that it was time for me to do another solo album,â€ explains Albert Castiglia about the new albumâ€™s genesis. â€œAt that moment, I felt I was ill-prepared for the task. I had been constantly touring with Mike for the last two years, doing very little writing, so I didnâ€™t have a lot of original material. My last two studio albums were quite thematic. With Masterpiece, the album centered around the discovery of my daughter. I Got Love was fueled by my life during the pandemic of 2020. What would be the thing that fuels the next one? It concerned me because if Iâ€™m not living the songs, itâ€™ll never work. It had to mean something to me. Mike suggested we make it an album with guests, my friends so to speak. I was concerned my friends wouldnâ€™t have time to devote to the project. I was wrong, so wrong. Joe Bonamassa, Josh Smith, Kevin Burt, Gary Hoey, Ally Venable, Popa Chubby, Rick Estrin, Kid and Lisa Andersen, Alabama Mike, Jimmy Carpenter, Kingfish Ingram, Danielle Nicole, Monster Mike Welch, Jerry Jemmott, D-Mar Martin, Jon Otis, Jim Pugh and others stepped up for me. My daughter Rayne even participated, which was the cherry on top. Suddenly,the theme became clear. Itâ€™s about friends and family. Itâ€™s about Righteous Souls.â€

â€œI think Righteous Souls is a big step forward artistically for my friend Albert Castiglia,â€ says Gulf Coast president Mike Zito. â€œHis singing, the songs, and his guitar playing are highly elevated on this new album. Itâ€™s fantastic to watch Albert grow as an artist; he is one of a kind.â€

The new album is chock-full of Albert Castigliaâ€™s signature sounds: blistering guitar licks flavored with righteously-soulful vocals that send a powerful blues message. Along with a number of original songs, Righteous Souls includes Castigliaâ€™s takes on a batch of cover songs from Willie Dixon, Buddy Guy, Eric Clapton/Rick Danko and two written by his former boss and mentor, the late, great Junior Wells (â€œCome On In This Houseâ€ and â€œWhat My Mama Told Me ).â€

âœª Gulf Coast Records Announces the Signing of Powerhouse Blues/Soul Singer Lara Price and the Release of Her Label Debut, Half & Half on June 21st âœª

Mike Zito, president of Gulf Coast Records, announces the signing of powerhouse blues and soul singer Lara Price and the upcoming June 21st release of her label debut album, Half & Half, on both CD and vinyl formats, with digital pre-orders starting on May 3rd and CD pre-orders now available at laraprice.com

â€‹

The albumâ€™s first single, â€œWeâ€™re Still Friendsâ€ (featuring Mike Zito) will be released on May 17, to be followed by â€œRainâ€ on June 7th. Now based in Austin, Texas, Lara Price recorded the album partly in Texas and partly in the San Francisco Bay Area, hence its title.

â€‹

â€œHalf & Half was a way for me to honor the San Francisco Bay Area music family, because without them I wouldnâ€™t be able to keep up in this Austin music scene,â€ said Lara Price. â€œThe other â€˜halfâ€™ is a representation of what I have learned so far, as I have soaked up eight years- worth of Austin music. I feel like I am JUST scratching the service as to what the Austin music scene is about and I look forward to putting that experience on my next album. Technically, the album was recorded 60% in Texas 40% in California with 22 musicians and three studios in two states,â€ she added about the recording sessions.

â€‹

â€œLara Price has been a fantastic artist for years,â€ said Mike Zito in announcing her signing. â€œSheâ€™s so deserving of a national audience. Her voice is soulful and righteous and I expect our fans to fall in love with her.â€

â€œI donâ€™t think words can express how excited I am to be joining the GCR family,â€ stated Lara Price. â€œThe caliber of musicianship on this label is humbling, and I look forward to rising to the level. Thank you, GRC for the much needed wind in my sails. See you at the gig!â€

About Lara Price:

Abandoned at birth, Lara Price became a part of the controversial Operation Baby Lift, the mass evacuation of orphans from South Vietnam to the United States. Her journey out of Vietnam to her new home was nothing short of a miracle, as 90 percent of the orphaned babies did not survive. Lara Price is a survivor.

â€‹

Lara arrived in the San Francisco Bay Area in 1997 to pursue her dream of singing in a band. The journey of Laraâ€™s career includes tours across the United States, China, multiple bands, one DVD, seven CDs that Lara Price has produced, co-written, and on which she has played multiple instruments. Her sixth CD,

I Mean Business, was exactly that, earning her a Best Soul/Blues Female Artist nomination for 2017 by the Blues Foundation. Laraâ€™s journey continued in Austin, where she released on her seventh album, Makinâ€™ Lemonade Lara Price LIVE from ATX.

What the critics have said about Lara Price:

â€œThe proof is in the performance. Price's vocal instrument is as strong as it is sensual, confident in covering the breadth of material in her songbook.â€- San Francisco Chronicle, 2003

â€œLara Priceâ€¦combines Gladys Knightâ€™s sophistication with Mavis Staple Gritâ€ - Boston Globe , November, 2015

â€œStrong performances mark Lara Price as a force in the soul blues arena!â€ - Blues Blast Magazine, March 2016

â€œIf you enjoy the soul blues stylings of women like Trudy Lynn, Etta James, and Etta Jones, youâ€™ll find plenty to latch onto with Priceâ€™s I Mean Business.â€ - Blues Revue, March, 2016

Female Soul Blues Artist Nomination alongside Mavis Staples and Bettye LaVette -- Blues Foundation, 2017

âœª Gulf Coast Records Announces the Signing of Chris BadNews Barnes

and Will Release His Label Debut, BadNews Travels Fast, Produced by Multi-Grammy Winner Tom Hambridge, on April 26th. âœª

Gulf Coast Records announces the signing of Nashville-based blues/rock singer Chris BadNews Barnes and the April 26th release date for his label debut album, BadNews Travels Fast.

â€‹

BadNews Travels Fast was produced by multi-Grammy winner Tom Hambridge, who also played drums on the sessions and co-wrote all of the songs on the new disc with Barnes. Joining in the recording fun was an â€œA-Listâ€ of Nashville musicians, along with such special guests as singers Jimmy Hall and Sugaray Rayford and guitarist Walter Trout.

â€œI have been a fan of Chris Barnes for years,â€ said Gulf Coast label head Mike Zito in announcing the signing. â€œHe is obviously very well known for his comedic acting and writing from â€˜SNLâ€™ to â€˜Seinfeldâ€™ and â€˜Curb Your Enthusiasmâ€™ appearances. I took real notice of Chris a few years back when we played together at The Big Blues Bender. Chris is a sincere singer/songwriter with a style all his own. His stage presence is nothing short of exuberant. Gulf Coast Records is proud to have Chris Barnes join our family in 2024!â€

â€œIâ€™m honored to have found a home for my original songs with fellow artists who are also true friends,â€ stated Chris BadNews Barnes. â€œGulf Coast has built a Castle for todayâ€™s cutting-edge Blues Artist and Iâ€™m grateful to be inside The Gates. Mike and Gulf Coast...I Offer You My Sword, Now letâ€™s Go Slay Some Dragons!

â€œThis is my fifth album and the second produced by Grammy Award-Winning Tom Hambridge,â€ added Barnes. â€œWalter Trout, Jimmy Hall, and Sugaray Rayford have all lent their talents for this impassioned and personal Contemporary Blues Album. â€œ

Gulf Coast Records Announces the Signing of New England-Based Blues/Roots Band, The Wicked Lo-Down, and Will Release Their Label Debut, Out of Line, on March 8th

Band Will Celebrate Album Release with Gulf Coast Records Revue at

14th Annual Winter Blues Festival in February

Gulf Coast Records announces the signing of New England-based blues/roots band, The Wicked Lo-Down, and will release their label debut CD, Out of Line, on March 8th, 2024. The Wicked Lo-Down is comprised of Nick David - Vocals/Harmonica; Paul Size â€“ Guitar; Jeffrey Berg â€“ Guitar/ Background Vocals; Brad Hallen â€“ Bass; and Nick Toscano â€“ Drums. Out of Line was produced by The Wicked Lo-Down and recorded, mixed and mastered by Jeffrey Berg at Walking Stick Studios, Auburn Mass. Pre-order The Wicked Lo-Down album here: https://www.wickedld.com/.

â€œNick David has a blues and rock â€˜nâ€™ roll sound thatâ€™s deep and soulful,â€ said Gulf Coast label head Mike Zito in making the announcement. â€œHis singing, writing, and harp playing are old school, yet fresh all at once. The Wicked Lo-Down is a fantastic group behind Nick. Paul Size on guitar is legendary in Texas Blues. Together they bring an exciting new album to the genre and Gulf Coast Records.â€

â€œThe Wicked Lo-Down couldnâ€™t be more excited to sign with Gulf Coast Records,â€ said lead singer Nick David. â€œWe are honored knowing that Mike Zito sees something in us and our music that is worth putting some muscle behind. Gulf Coast is the perfect label for the music that we are creating and we look forward to a long and fruitful relationship with them.â€

Formed in 2020 just before the Covid lockdown by guitar giant Paul Size (The Red Devils, Mick Jagger, Sugar Ray & the Bluetones) and powerhouse blues belter Nick David (Mr. Nick & the Dirty Tricks, Queen City Kings), The Wicked Lo-Down blends raw Texas blues and hard hitting Northeast R&B into their own completely original house rockin' sound. Their debut album, We Hot, received critical acclaim from some of the biggest names in the blues world and beyond. Consisting of ten well crafted, barn burners, We Hot established The Wicked Lo-Down as a true force to be reckoned- with and left no doubt that from Austin to Boston is how they roll.

As with their previous release, the focal point of Out of Line is on the songs. Highlighting the songwriting of Berg, David and Size, the band once again solidifies its place by continuing to carve out a lane all its own, making the new disc a must-listen for hard core fans of bands like The Red Devils and the original Fabulous Thunderbirds.

About â€œThe Wildest Oneâ€ track, Nick David says: â€œThe Wildest One (Lesterâ€™s Boogie)â€ was written as a tribute to the great Lester Butler. â€œListening to Bill Withers tell a story or sing a song for me is one and the same,â€ adds Kevin Burt. â€œIt instantly attaches itself to my soul. Blueyâ€™s Juke Joint in Long Island City, New York, on October 24 and 25, 2022, and features Popa Chubby (guitar and vocals), backed by his all-star â€œBeast Band,â€ which consists of Mike Merritt - bass (Conan Oâ€™Brien, Billy Gibbons); Mike DiMeo - keyboards (Johnny Winter, Tommy James); and Stefano Giudici - drums.

â€œThis record is a reunion in a lot of ways,â€ stated Popa Chubby. â€œRejoining with my long-time ally and bassist extraordinaire Mike Merritt and recording in my old Mannyâ€™s Car Wash engineer Glen Forrestâ€™s studio. The icing on the cake was Mike Dimeo on keys. Add the Centurion Stefano Giudici on drums and youâ€™ve got some heavy blues rock! Itâ€™s a live best of for the ages!â€

â€‹â€œIn the early â€˜90s, Popa Chubby was the house band at New York Cityâ€™s Mannyâ€™s Car Wash,â€ says the man, himself. â€œI hosted the jam every Sunday that saw everyone from the Allman Brothers, Stephen Stills, Joe Sample, Odetta and many more pass through. â€‹

Born Ted Horowitz, Popa Chubby is a long-time, New York City veteran blues rocker, who also produced and mixed his upcoming new album. Heâ€™s been hard-rocking the blues in his fierce and soulful way for more than 35 years. Over the course of his career, he has been a force to be reckoned with on the guitar, and his tempestuous, soulful playing has never been more powerful. An imposing figure with a shaven head, tattooed arms, a goatee and a performance style he describes as â€œthe Stooges meets Buddy Guy, MotoÌˆrhead meets Muddy Waters and Jimi Hendrix meets Robert Johnson,â€ Popa Chubby is an endearing character who has become one of the genreâ€™s most popular figures.

His career has always been about moving forward and carving a place for himself in the imposing terrain of the music business, overcoming odds to continue growing and maturing as a creative force. He has built a constantly increasing base of fans across the world, where in many territories he is a star. A native New Yorker, his first gigs were in the NYC punk scene as a guitarist for what he reflects was a "crazy Japanese special effects performance artist in a kimono called â€˜Screaming Mad George,â€™ who had a horror-movie inspired show.â€ Right from the start, he was immersed in rock â€˜nâ€™ roll as theater, and learned from George and others playing CBGBâ€™s at the time that included the Ramones, the Cramps, Richard Hell, whose band -the Voidoids - he joined, that rock â€˜nâ€™ roll should be dangerous. He reflects, "Musicians like the Ramones and the Sex Pistols werenâ€™t just bands. They were a threat to society."

The blues, however, was the foundation of his playing style. He recalls, "Since Iâ€™d grown up on Hendrix, Cream and Led Zeppelin, when I started playing blues in New York clubs I understood that the blues should be dangerous, too. It wasnâ€™t just from playing in punk bands. Howlinâ€™ Wolf and Muddy Waters were dangerous men. For the Blood Brothers album, Mike Zito: vocals/guitars; Albert Castiglia: vocals/guitars â€“ brought together their two powerhouse bands, featuring Matt Johnson: drums; Ephraim Lowell: drums; Doug Byrkit: bass; Lewis Stephens: piano/organ. "Mike Zito and Albert Castiglia have done something special,â€ added co-producer Josh Smith. â€œThey have both found their musical confidante. Of the many insights into the songs on Blood Brothers, Mike Zito offered these two about â€œâ€˜In My Soulâ€™ and â€œOne Step Ahead of the Bluesâ€: â€œIn the summer of 2022, my wife Laura was diagnosed with cancer. â€œFor â€˜One Step Ahead of the Bluesâ€™: I am a JJ Cale fanatic. I love his voice and his style. Although JJ did not write this song, his recording has always been on my playlist. It just fits this band and album with Albert. It turned into a great duet that makes for a strong bond.â€

Albert Castiglia ventured inspirations for â€œA Thousand Heartachesâ€ and â€œTooth and Nailâ€: â€œIn March of 2022, while on tour in Delaware with The Blood Brothers, Mike asked me to write a ballad for the new album, because we were well-stocked with up tempo numbers and needed to change the pace a little. Iâ€™ve been through unreciprocated and forbidden love in my life, but never had the songwriting chops to express how I felt in the midst of it. â€œAnd when Tinsley Ellis writes a song for you, you listen! Looking more in-person like a woman who could be your next door neighbor rather than the scorching blues rock guitar goddess that she is, Joanna Connor is an atypical and unassuming guitar heroine who absolutely shreds or tenderly caresses notes out of a Gibson Les Paul. Those who are in the know rave about a musician who has played behind Buddy Guy, Junior Wells, Otis Rush and Luther Allison; and shared stages with the likes of Jimmy Page, Robben Ford, Robert Cray, the Doobie Brothers, Etta James and numerous other legends. Photo by: Maryam Wilcher

Joanna Connor was born in Brooklyn, New York, raised in Worcester, Massachusetts, and after beginning her career there at the age of 17, packed a suitcase, a Fender Twin Amp, a guitar and bought a bus ticket to the Blues Mecca of Chicago, where her goal was to be in a cracking blues band learning from the best . A mere month after moving to the Windy City, Delta blues heavyweight Johnny Littlejohn hired her. A few months after that, Dion Payton enlisted her to be a part of his 43rd Street Blues Band, where they held residencies at the hallowed Checkerboard Lounge and the Kingston Mines blues clubs, and were the backing band behind every major talent in the city. Joanna went on to tour with sax great AC Reed before starting her own band at the urging of the Kingston Mines owner. Blind Pig Records signed Joanna in 1989 and released several records on her before she went on to become the second artist to sign with Ruf Records; subsequently releasing many records for the German-based label, which led to a decade of touring throughout Europe.

In 2002, The House of Blues in Chicago offered Joanna and her band a weekly residency, and with her additional residency at the Kingston Mines, Connor made the decision to come off the road touring grind for a while and work locally four nights per week, while raising her two children as a single mom. Joanna also recorded several albums for the highly-respected MC Records during that decade.

â€‹â€‹

In 2019, one of the videos of her fierce guitar work caught the eyes and ears of one of the most prominent guitarists of the modern era -Joe Bonamassa - as well as director Adrian Lynne (Flash Dance, Fatal Attraction). Lynne offered her a scene performing in the movie, Deep Water, starring Ben Affleck. At the same time, Joe Bonamassa and his KTBA Records label gave her the opportunity to make a studio album. Both projects happened right before the COVID 19 epidemic and subsequent lockdown. The KTBA album, 4801 South Indiana, was released in February of 2021 to immense critical acclaim and a number one spot on the Billboard blues chart. The Deep Water film was released on Hulu in March, 2022.

Joanna and her band went right back to work in April of 2021. With a band of young virtuoso musicians she dubbed the â€œWrecking Crew 22,â€ fires were started worldwide on stages everywhere. Joanna reached out to one of her most beloved musicians, Mike Zito and Gulf Coast Records in hopes that this tsunami of musical energy and passion could be unleashed on record, and soon everyone will hear what all the excitement is about.
